Name: Red Lion (Difford's recipe)
Ingredients: 22.5 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
2.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Nick & Nora glass .
RIM glass with sugar (moisten the outside edge with orange juice and dip into sugar).
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over cocktail and discard.
Review: The sophisticated drinker's answer to a gin and juice with dry gin and orange liqueur made all the more fruity with orange juice, lemon juice and pomegranate syrup.
History: Adapted from Arthur Tarling's 1933 competition-winning Red Lion recipe by yours truly in August 2016. See: Red Lion cocktail history
Nutrition: One serving of Red Lion (Difford's recipe) contains 183 calories
